fields.summary: Clicking on the little triangle on the admin section in "Issues" admin tab does not expand the admin section, but it does collapse other expanded section.

fields.description:
We need to provide a convenient way for users to do this (especially when they purchase new applications).

See the attached image for an initial design provided by Samantha.

If the flexibility the attached design provides is too much to implement before Summit, we can probably have an interim solution that addresses the most likely use cases by allowing users to add FE/Conf/Bamboo to every existing project when FE/Conf/Bamboo are enabled
fields.summary: As a Jira On Demand administrator, I want to bulk add and/or remove project components

fields.description:
At the moment, you can do link a new component to a Jira project by clicking 'Select' links on the ViewProject details page, which forwards you to EditProjectLinks.jspa.

However, this is Jira functionality that is not overridden by studio, and the applink is created only from Jira to the new component. To get this working properly in studio, we need to override or intercept the Jira action, and notify the other applications that a new component has been added to the project.
fields.summary: As a Jira On Demand administrator, I want to add components (confluence space, fe repository etc) to an existing project
Rip out existing Activity Streams 3.x tests from Studio
Clean up uses of XStreamsUtils in studio

fields.description:
See for example https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-JOBC-39/test/case/186622780

This is because it's clicking any link with 'deleteProject' in the URL. The link to SAC always includes the URL of the current page, so after clicking one of the delete links the next page that loads will include that text in the support link, and the test setup tries to follow it.
fields.summary: Functional Tests click links to SAC, fail when it's being upgraded

fields.description:
1) Use cleanDeployUnicornGApps to provision a new Unicorn instance (I haven't verified, but it probably happens with non-GApps too)
2) As soon as JIRA is running, log in as sysadmin.
3) Create a new project.

It fails with a timeout - presumably because not all the apps are running yet.

With customers provisioning their own instances via HAL and getting access to them right away, this could be an issue in Unicorn.
fields.summary: Different app startup times can cause timeouts on project creation

fields.description:
AOD-4426 introduced dynamic applink deletion/creation as apps are disabled/enabled. Currently, we will always create the SVN AppLink with the public URL for all apps. However, need the local file:// URL.

- Bamboo: needs public URL so that elastic agents can access the repo (they use the SVN Applink to determine the URL).
- FeCru: prefer the local URL for performance.
- JIRA: prefer the local URL for performance of jira-fisheye plugin
- Confluence: curently, set to public URL in initial data, but gets switched back to local URL at test setup time. Checked on StAC, where it's the local URL. It may be that confluence never uses this anyway. Let's use the local URL (so Bamboo is the only outlier).
fields.summary: Pick the correct URL for the SVN applink (internal or public) when re-creating the applink when enabling an app in à la carte mode.
Enable users to select any of the bundled Confluence themes when running Confluence as part of Studio

fields.description:
Currently, studio allows bamboo alone to be disabled through a config file or JVM property that is read into theme properties. In this case, bamboo doesn't start up at all.

Once 'a la carte' is in, the mechanism for disabling bamboo (and other applications) will be different, and the applications will still be running although they aren't accessible. Therefore, we should remove the themeProperties.isBambooEnabled property and replace with AppStatus based checks wherever appropriate.

I also think we should do away with the BAMLESS trunk build (and instead ensure that our functional tests adequately test all the cases with different combinations of enabled applications).
fields.summary: Remove usage of themeProperties.isBambooEnabled check throughout the code and tests
Remove a la carte enabled checks from the code and tests
History dropdown doesn't work in JIRA as of 4.3.1

fields.description:
Confluence On Demand standalone will be significantly different to the current Confluence hosted offering. The major differences are:
 1. Upgrades will follow the studio confluence upgrade cycle
 2. We will not bundle arbitrary plugins
 3. Will be served from Unicorn

Note: There will not be an easy and automatic upgrade path from 'Confluence On Demand' -> 'Confluence On Demand' + 'Jira On Demand', so we do not have to cater for this

Ideally, we would like to use the studio fireball itself to serve Confluence On Demand, with a different install and startup mechanism to strip out studio-specific confluence plugins.

If this is not possible in the Summit timeframe, another alternative will be to modify the Enterprise Hosted Confluence fireball to make it run on Unicorn.
fields.summary: As Atlassian, we would like an automated way to provision and deploy Confluence On Demand standalone on Unicorn

fields.description:

Works fine in the previous release. Possibly related to changes made in https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-4373 .

fields.summary: Project menu doesn't expand in JIRA
As a Studio developer, I would like every green build to be deployed to a Unicorn server

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Having anonymous access in the Studio version of Confluence is a big plus (thanks!), but since it is opened up to the world when enabled, styling may be important (to match another web site, etc.). There are several use cases where this makes sense - product documentation, product pages, corporate blog, entire Internet website (my own desire - I would love to just use Confluence for our corporate site), etc. Confluence is such a powerful publishing platform, it's a shame that the Studio version gets stylistically "locked-in". On the other hand, I understand that the unified look and feel of Studio is one of it's selling points and critical features. Could a system be implemented that allows the selection of an "alternate" theme for anonymous or external users? Or maybe through an alternate URL? At a minimum, could the unified navigation portions (such as the top-level tabs) be turned off for anonymous users or through a special URL?

I would also request that the Theme Builder Plugin be supported to assist in the creation of themes (perhaps as an alternative to fully opening up the theming engine). Might the built-in capabilities of Theme Builder to adjust styles on the fly actually be leveraged for this multiple theme concept? https://www.adaptavist.com/display/ADAPTAVIST/Builder.
fields.summary: Allow Alternate Themes / Theme Builder Plugin

*Original request description:*
It would be helpful to be able to bring arbitrary content into our JIRA Studio Confluence instances. I'm thinking specifically of writing a stylesheet to convert the XML source code documentation generated by tools (doxygen, Sandcastle, etc.) into something the Content Import Plugin can recognize. Having access to this plugin would also be helpful in migrating from other wiki systems or even database content stores to JIRA Studio.
fields.summary: Include the Content Import Plugin

This issue relates to the screen at jira/secure/admin/EditAppStatus.jspa

This issue replaces AOD-4387.

This is quite a low priority because this is a fairly simple sysadmin only screen, that we test a lot during development.
The rest calls that the javascript on this screen makes are tested thoroughly in TestAppStatusRestHelper.

fields.description:
The workaround for this is hacky. See AddUserInterceptor in AGMP. It contains {quote}Adding this error twice is overkill, but we need to ensure that the error field is set when we call proceed *and* that it's still correct afterwards. JIRA overwrites our value in some cases and we need to correct that.{quote}

We need a better way to work around JIRA stomping on error messages being a problem.

fields.description:
As of AOD-4396, {{AppStatusServletFilter}} blocks users from accessing disabled apps, but should always let sysadmins through.
However, if a FeCru is disabled and a sysadmin accesses a Crucible URL (/cru/*) without previously accessing a FishEye URL, they will be blocked. This shouldn't have any impact on customers (who are never sysadmins).

The cause is that {{AppStatusServletFilter}} is applied before-login for Crucible URLs, else it's execution is blocked by Crucible's own filters (therefore, if the sysadmin's session is not already authenticated in FeCru, the sysadmin is not recognised by the filter and is blocked). We need to understand why Crucible's filters prevent {{AppStatusServletFilter}} from firing at the before-decoration stage, and whether there's a workaround.
fields.summary: When FeCru is disabled in à la carte mode, even sysadmins are blocked when accessing a /cru URL directly, unless they are already authenticated.

fields.description:
Here's what I was doing when this happened (no idea if this is what triggered the error):

* I was logged in as "sysadmin" - a local sysadmin user.
* I was using the user browser to see what users were available.
* I searched for a username containing "wyatt"
* One result came up (a user called "pwyatt"). 
* I clicked the user name to view the user profile and got an error page.
* Any subsequent hits to the instance also produced the same error.

fields.description:
In a GApps-enabled instance, if the current user is not a Google user, I'd expect the links to "Attach Google Docs" not to be present on Create/View/Edit issue. 

Currently they are there, but if you click them, the "Attach Google Docs" dialog pops up with an error.

!AttachGoogleDocs1.png!

!AttachGoogleDocs2.png!
fields.summary: Non-Google users see "attach Google docs" link on Create/View/Edit Issue
Remove theme mode as a separate entity that can be modified independently of the app status

fields.description:
In the "Source" tab of the View Issue page, I clicked the link "Create crucible review  for this changeset in <this project>", but I am still asked to choose a project to create the review in on the next screen, and the default project listed in the drop-down list is not the one from the previous screen. I guess the customer might find this screen flow a bit uncomfortable.
!create-review-1.png!
fields.summary: The screen flow for creating issue from JIRA is not very natual
When bamboo is disabled, the Jira bamboo plugin should be disabled

fields.description:
When an application is disabled, the following should happen:
  * All applinks from other applications to the disabled application (including project applinks) should be removed
  * All applinks from the disabled application to any other application should be removed

When an application is enabled, the following should happen: 
  * Each of the other applications should setup a default applink to the enabled application
  * The enabled application should setup default applinks to each of the other enabled applications
  * No project applinks to/from the enabled application should be setup automatically (at this stage, users will need to re-associate project components manually).
fields.summary: Create/delete the relevant applinks when an application is enabled/disabled
ReprovisionTest failures
Set the default repository path on the Bamboo job creation form
Add User page shows both titles replaced by studio-theme-jira-plugin and integration-jira-plugin
Remove display of svn authentication details from Bamboo job creation form

fields.description:
This error was picked up while working AOD-4359.

JSON rest requests to bamboo return a 500 Status Code. Bamboo receives the request, and processes it correctly, but then fails with the following error when writing the response. 

The error is:
SEVERE: A message body writer for Java type, class com.atlassian.studio.common.appstatus.rest.AppStatusServiceResultRepresentation, and MIME media type, application/json, was not found

Chances are that the error is due to a missing json or jaxb dependency in bamboo.
